channel.title: Cointelegraph.com News
channel.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest crypto news and analyses on the future of money.

image.title: Cointelegraph.com News
image.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest crypto news and analyses on the future of money.

item.title: FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried urges court to dismiss charges
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brian Quarmby
item.description: Lawyers representing Sam Bankman-Fried want all but three charges against him dismissed in a filing on May 8.

item.title: Canada’s central bank asks citizens what they want in a digital dollar
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Jesse Coghlan
item.description: Canadians are being asked what features they wish to see in a digital Canadian dollar even though there are no plans yet to issue one.

item.title: Worth it? Trader spends $120K on gas buying $155K worth of a memecoin
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Mitchelhill
item.description: A user spent an additional 76% of their total purchase price in gas fees on a single memecoin trade.

item.title: Bittrex files for Chapter 11 bankruptcy just weeks after SEC charges
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: The firm estimated it had more than 100,000 creditors, between $500 million and $1 billion in assets, and between $500 million and $1 billion in liabilities.

item.title: MakerDAO launches Spark Protocol, a new DeFi lending solution for DAI users
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Judith BannermanQuist
item.description: The initial iteration of the Spark Protocol will function as a lending platform, offering supply and borrow functionalities for cryptocurrencies ETH, stETH, DAI and sDAI.

item.title: Paxful restarts marketplace operations for the first time since April
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: Amid the suspended service, Ray Youssef said he had made his "final act" as CEO after helping unfreeze 88% of certain users’ accounts.

item.title: Argentina says no to crypto payments, France tolerates ‘finfluencers’: Law Decoded, May 1–8
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By David Attlee
item.description: Argentina’s central bank banned payment providers from offering crypto transactions, adding that it intends to reduce the country’s payment-system exposure to digital assets.

item.title: State-sponsored Chinese AI firm launches bot service to ‘surpass’ ChatGPT
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tristan Greene
item.description: Chinese tech company iFlytek recently made waves with the launch of its “Spark Model,” an AI system it says will surpass ChatGPT by the end of the year.

item.title: South Korean lawmaker allegedly cashed out while legislating on crypto: Report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: National Assembly member Kim Nam-kuk had authority in handling laws related to digital assets in South Korea, reportedly backing a bill proposing a 20% crypto gains tax be deferred.

item.title: Crypto remains hopeful as market moves sideways: Report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Cointelegraph Research
item.description: BTC continues to trade in a narrow range, and memecoins steal the limelight from NFTs as views on the macroeconomic outlook diverge.

item.title: Cetus DEX's IDO oversubscribed after Sui mainnet launch
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Zhiyuan Sun
item.description: According to developers, the fundraising goal of the initial DEX offering was reached in less than one minute.

item.title: China issues first arrest over fake news created with ChatGPT: Report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tristan Greene
item.description: Alleged fake news poster becomes the first person in China arrested for using artificial intelligence platform ChatGPT.

item.title: What are liquidity provider (LP) tokens, and how do they work?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Emi Lacapra
item.description: Providing liquidity to a pool could be another source of passive income in crypto. Find out here what liquidity provider tokens are and how they work.

item.title: Aave v3 launches on Ethereum layer-2 network Metis
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Gareth Jenkinson
item.description: Ethereum layer-2 protocols continue to attract the biggest players in the decentralized finance sector, with liquidity protocol Aave deploying on scaling network Metis.

item.title: Coinbase execs visit UAE to test potential of ‘strategic hub’ for international operations
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: “I think the U.S. right now is a little bit behind in terms of regulatory clarity and some of the rhetoric from the top," said Brian Armstrong at the Dubai FinTech Summit.

item.title: What is the risk/reward ratio in cryptocurrency trading, and how to use it
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Marcel Deer
item.description: Risk/reward ratio is a measure to determine potential profit against potential loss. In crypto trading, it helps manage risk by setting stop-loss and take-profit levels.

item.title: Does Bitcoin price risk losing $28K with BTC futures premium at 2-month lows?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Marcel Pechman
item.description: Professional Bitcoin traders are favoring sideways price action as the BTC futures premium drops and the options delta skew nears 0%.

item.title: 5 common interview questions for Web3 jobs
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Alice Ivey
item.description: The interview process for Web3 positions will typically involve questions aimed at assessing a candidate’s knowledge of decentralized technologies, blockchain and smart contracts.

item.title: Why is Bitcoin price down today?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By William Suberg
item.category: why is the crypto market down
is crypto in a bear market
when will bitcoin price go up
item.description: Bitcoin price is down today as Binance, record high fees and a full mempool render on-chain transacting slow and expensive.

item.title: ‘Ethical’ SBF game axed, Web3 games sign-up process sucks, Tomb Chaser: Web3 Gamer
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Callan Quinn
item.description: FTX’s kiss of death for Storybook Brawl, Scratch Lord creators make MMA game for Animoca, and why is Web3 game onboarding so awful?

item.title: Bitcoin takes flight in Liechtenstein: Minister proposes government services paid in crypto
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Joe Hall
item.description: Prime Minister Daniel Risch of Liechtenstein told local papers that Bitcoin is set to play a growing role in government services payments.

item.title: AI is coming for your job: What industries will be affected?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Luke Huigsloot
item.category: Artificial Intelligence (AI) has been growing fast
and LLM tools such as OpenAI's ChatGPT may soon replace many jobs
particularly in industries like banking and insurance according to Accenture.
item.description: According to Accenture, 40% of working hours across different industries could be lost to AI as tools like ChatGPT continue to improve.

item.title: Human ID project ‘Worldcoin’ launches gas-free wallet only for humans
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Blackstone
item.description: The wallet relies on “World ID,” a protocol that verifies humanness through zero-knowledge proofs.

item.title: Tencent-backed Everledger collapses amid lack of funding: Report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Helen Partz
item.description: Everledger was quietly placed into insolvency after it didn’t manage to materialize its planned funding round from an undisclosed investor.

item.title: Bitcoin options: How to play it when BTC price moves up or down 10%
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Marcel Pechman
item.description: A perfect storm is forming for higher volatility. Learn how to profit from BTC price moves on either side.

item.title: Defending against SEC to cost Ripple $200M, CEO Brad Garlinghouse says
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Amaka Nwaokocha
item.description: Ripple’s CEO reveals $200 million spent defending the SEC lawsuit, and laments about U.S. crypto regulation and a politics-first policy, advising entrepreneurs to avoid the United States.

item.title: Binance ‘FUD’ meets CPI — 5 things to know in Bitcoin this week
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By William Suberg
item.description: A spike in transaction fees and repeated BTC withdrawal outages at Binance provide a fraught backdrop to a week of Bitcoin volatility triggers.

item.title: China is developing AI without US chips: Here’s how
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Savannah Fortis
item.description: U.S. sanctions have limited China’s access to the latest chip technology to develop AI, but local companies are not letting this stop them.

item.title: Nigeria goes blockchain: Policy could impact digital identity
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Amaka Nwaokocha
item.description: Nigeria’s crypto community celebrates the approval of the National Blockchain Policy, set to impact governance, digital identity management and e-payments.

item.title: Pepe’s sudden drop leaves whale 500k in the red
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Mitchelhill
item.description: A memecoin whale who purchased roughly $3 million worth of the Pepe token just days ago is now sitting on an unrealized loss of around $600,000.
